newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft launches refurbished Microsoft Network.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft launches refurbished Microsoft Network.

text.p: Microsoft Corp on Tuesday launched a retooled version of Microsoft Network (MSN), its Internet online service.
Microsoft said it had sent out more than 3.5 million CDs with the installation software to current members and new customers who have requested it.

The service recently ended a preview run and is now available to U.S. customers. Monthly rates run from $6.95 for the first five hours to $19.95 for unlimited usage. Discounted annual rates are also available, Microsoft said.
Microsoft has said it will spend $100 million in the current fiscal year to promote the new MSN.
It also said it does not expect a profit from MSN for at least three years.
MSN's new interface will be based on the Microsoft Internet Explorer browser and will focus heavily on entertainment and transaction services, such as online trading and shopping.

"We created MSN to deliver the Internet experience that consumers have told us they're looking for -- one that is informative and fun and that helps them easily make sense of the Internet," said Laura Jennings, vice president of MSN.
Microsoft says MSN, launced along with Windows 95 in August 1995, has more than 1.6 million subscribers, a distant third behind America Online and CompuServe.
